body.head.byline: By FRED BIERMAN and BENJAMIN HOFFMAN

block.p: Known for his work in the paint, Spurs forward/center TIM DUNCAN showed his versatility Wednesday in a victory against the Hornets when he made a 3-pointer in the second quarter with the shot clock expiring.
It was the first 3-pointer of the season for Duncan, a 7-footer from Wake Forest.

It was the first 3-pointer of the season for Duncan, a 7-footer from Wake Forest.
''If they allowed me to, during the All-Star game I'd join the 3-point shooting contest,'' Duncan told reporters after the game.
Duncan may want to hold off though; it was the 23rd 3-pointer of his career. His teammate BRENT BARRY made five in the game to give him 1,291 in his career.

LeBRON JAMES seems to be all about suburbia of late. Not only is he the new spokesman for Cub Cadet riding lawn mowers (take a peek at the advertisement on YouTube), but he is also building a huge new house in Bath Township, Ohio, about 20 minutes south of Cleveland.

According to The Akron Beacon Journal, the house will be more than 34,000 square feet and will have a two-lane bowling alley, a casino (no one seems quite sure how that is going to work), a barbershop, an aquarium, a recording studio, a six-car garage and a sports bar.
The house will come within 800 feet of 19 other houses. The neighbors are already complaining about people snapping pictures of the construction site.

On Thursday night on TNT, a commercial was broadcast showing a film of Red Auerbach discussing the virtues of team defense. It was unfortunate timing, coming during the Phoenix Suns-Golden State Warriors matchup, a game in which the Warriors scored 45 points in the first quarter and the halftime score was 77-63.

While Warriors guard JASON RICHARDSON, above, was on his way to a team-record eight 3-pointers and a game-high 36 points, the Suns didn't punish Golden State for venturing into the paint. The Warriors shot only 3 free throws in the first half and 14 in the game.
